intro: Agrostophyllum stipulatum, commonly known as the stipulate grass-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its ecological significance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local fauna.
